channel.title: Brett-Whitehead family history
channel.description: Recent content on Brett-Whitehead family history

item.title: About
item.description: This is a history website for the family of John Brett and Margaret Joy Whitehead.

item.title: Alice Jane Braginton
item.description: Alice Jane’s birth record is probably: Births Mar 1846 BRAGINTON Alice Jane Torrington 10 325 This page on Braginton family history has her baptism date as 1845, and this Genenet page says she was baptised on 22nd December 1845. Alice Jane married Samuel Henry Farwell Roe in 1890. She died on 28 October 1929: Deaths Dec 1929 Roe Alice J 84 Liskeard 5c 44 Alice Jane’s probate is:

item.title: Braginton - Vicary
item.description: See this page on Braginton family history. George Braginton, the oldest son of Richard Braginton, was baptised on 28 Feb 1808 in Ottery St Mary, Devon. On 13 Jan 1835, at St Giles in the Wood, he married Margaret Grace Vicary, the widow of William Cotton. Also Alice Braginton’s Genenet entry and links therein. George Braginton was baptised on 28 Feb 1808, and died in 1886. Margaret Grace Vicary was baptised 6 Dec 1807, and died in 1868.

item.title: Braginton family history
item.description: See this page on Braginton family history: George Braginton, the oldest son of Richard Braginton, was baptised on 28 Feb 1808 in Ottery St Mary, Devon. On 13 Jan 1835, at St Giles in the Wood, he married Margaret Grace Vicary, the widow of William Cotton. Margaret Grace Vicary, the daughter of Thomas Cornish Vicary and Margaret Fry, was baptised at Great Torrington, Devon on 6 Dec 1807. Her marriage to William Cotton produced two children.

item.title: Brett - Howcroft
item.description: There is a Mary Ann Brett at this MyHeritage.com page that appears to match John Brett’s partner and Michael’s mother. FeeBMD has no record of a marriage between “John Brett” and someone with surname “Howcroft” between 1840 and 1902. Christiana Payne’s biography notes that “as far as anyone has been able to ascertain, John Brett and Mary Ann Howcroft […] were never actually married.” The record for John Brett’s household in the 1881 census records these household members at No 6 Keswick Road, London:

item.title: Brett - Lee
item.description: Data for the family of Michael Brett and Nellie Mary Lee. They married in 1902 - see BMD record. Michael’s census record for 1911 shows him to be living in Hangerlea, Stansted Road, Bishop’s Stortford, with this household: Name Age Michael Brett 39 Nellie Mary Brett 29 Joan Brett 8 John Brett 6 Peter Brett 1 Tirzah Faulder 25 Caroline Alice Hudgell 24 Annie Amelia Smith 27 Children Joan Brett (1903) John Brett (1905) Peter Brett (1910) See BMD record for Joan, Peter’s records; John’s birth record is a little more difficult to work out.

item.title: Brett - Pilbean
item.description: These are notes for the family of Charles Curtis Brett and Ann Pilbean. See Charles Curtis Brett’s wikitree entry. This says that he married Ann “Pilbin” on 12 June 1823. The Dictionary of National Biography has this as “Pilbean”, and Ann’s birth year as 1808/9 - see page on John Brett (painter). Charles Curtis Brett’s household in the 1851 census: Name Age Relation Profession Charles C Brett 67 Head Vetinary surgeon ?

item.title: Brett - Whitehead
item.description: Note for the family of John Brett (b 1905) and (Margaret) Joy Whitehead. They married on 5 May 1928. See also BMD record. John and Joy had three children: Sue Oliver (1929). Jenifer Brooke-Smith (1931). Martin Brett (1939). See BMD records.

item.title: Burke's Peerage on Whitehead family
item.description: See this Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage, 1949 for a full summary of the Whitehead family tree to 1949. Quoting from that extract: Gilbert Hinds, b. 26 May, 1866 ; to. 10 April, 1901, •Helena Emmeline, (New Raven, Eltham, Kent), only dau. of late Henry A. Langford, of Plymouth, and d. 18 Dec. 1908, leaving issue, Margaret Joy, m. 5 May, 1928, Lt.-Cmdr. John Brett, D.S.C., R.N., elder son of Michael Brett, of Bishop’s Stortford, and has issue.

item.title: Charles Curtis Brett
item.description: See Charles Curtis Brett’s wikitree entry. Grandfather: Curtis Brett (b ~1720), printer. CB wikitree entry. CB will. His children were Charles Richard Brett (born and died 1761) and Curtis Brett (b 1765) Father: Curtis Brett (b 1765). CB Jr wikitree entry. Charles Curtis married Ann Pilbean in 1823. His father, Charles Curtis Brett, had a background in both the army and the navy. He served as a midshipman on HMS Egmont, a 74-gun warship, between 1816 and 1823.

item.title: Clara Louisa Braginton
item.description: Clara Louisa’s parents were George Braginton and Margaret Grace Vicary. Also see this page on Braginton family history. From that page: Clara Louisa’s father was a shipowner, and probably named one of his ships “Clara Louisa” after his daughter. Clara was born in 1837 - see BMD record. Clara Louisa married Edmund Allen Johns in 1857. They had three children. Edmund Allen died in 1864. Clara Louisa married Henry Alfred Langford in 1866.

item.title: FreeBMD / GRO records
item.description: These are UK birth, marriage and death records from searches on https://www.freebmd.org.uk, or directly from the UK General Record Office. Births Period Surname First name(s) Mother District Vol Page Notes Dec 1837 BRAGINTON Louisa Launceston 9 125 Sep 1931 Brett Jenifer Whitehead Portsmouth 2b 771 Mar 1939 Brett Martin Whitehead Woolwich 1d 1299 6 January 1939 Mar 1903 Brett Joan Hendon 3a 220 Dec 1872 BRETT Michael Dorking 2a 137 Jun 1910 BRETT Peter B Stortford 3a 759 Mar 1865 Johns Edmund Allen Torrington 5b 549 Mar 1859 JOHNS Ellen Macarmick Torrington 5b 481 Jun 1868 LANGFORD Albert Leonard Plymouth 5b 265 Marriages Period Surname First name(s) Spouse surname District Vol Page Notes Jun 1928 Brett John Whitehead Lewisham 1d 2117 Mar 1902 Brett Michael Wandsworth 1d 929 Mar 1857 Johns Edmund Allen Torrington 5b 793 Jun 1866 LANGFORD Henry A Plymouth 5b 437 Jun 1890 Roe Samuel Henry F Portsea 2b 942 Jun 1901 Whitehead Gilbert Hinds Truro 5c 237 Deaths Period Surname First name(s) Age District Vol Page Notes Dec 1943 Brett Michael 72 Newton A.

item.title: Gilbert Hinds Whitehead
item.description: According to a Peerage.com page on Sir James Whitehead, Gilbert Hinds Whitehead was the fifth child (and third son) of Sir James Whitehead, 1st Baronet and Mercy Matilda Hinds. He married Helena Emmeline Langford. Death record (FreeBMD): Deaths Dec 1949 (>99%) Whitehead Helena E 77 Woolwich 5d 878 See also Whitehead family grave.

item.title: Helena Emmeline Langford
item.description: Martin Brett tells me that “Granny Whitehead” preferred “Emmeline”. Emmeline’s parents were Henry Albert Langford and Clara Louisa Braginton. Emmeline married Gilbert Hinds Whitehead. See also Whitehead family grave and Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage. In the 1881 census, Helena Emmilina Langford was at 5 North Hills Terrace, in the following household: Name Age Relation Marriage Profession Clara Louisa Langford 42 Head Widow Lady Ellen Macornick Johns 22 Daughter Single Lady Richard Braginton Johns 18 Son Single Solicitor’s articled clerk Helena Emmilina Langford 8 Daughter Single Scholar George Stawell Tuckey 27 Visitor Single Solicitor Fanny Gent 47 Servant Single Cook Domestic Elizabeth Dunn 16 Servant Single Housemaid See the HEL 1881 census original image

item.title: John Brett (b 1831)
item.description: See John Brett’s wikipedia entry The Dictionary of National Biography (1912) on John Brett (the painter). “BRETT, JOHN (1831–1902), landscape painter, born at Bletchingley, Surrey, on 8 Dec. 1831, was eldest son of Captain Charles Curtis Brett of the 12th lancers by his wife Ann Philbrick. […] He died in his house at Putney on 8 Jan. 1902. He married in 1870, and had four sons and three daughters who survived him.

item.title: John Brett (b 1905)
item.description: John died in World War 2, when his ship HMS Gloucester sank, on May 22nd 1941. He was born on 27 March 1905 (see Peerage.com article). He married Margaret Joy Whitehead on 5 May 1928. John’s parents were Michael Brett and Nellie Mary Lee. Michael was the eldest son of John Brett, the painter. He was commissioned into the Royal Navy on 15 September 1918, and gained these ranks: Midshipman: 15 January 1923 Sub-Lieutenant: 15 November 1925 Lieutenant: 15 November 1927 Lieutenant-Commander: 15 November 1935.

item.title: John Brett: Pre-Raphaelite Landcape Painter
item.description: A biography of John Brett: John Brett Pre-Raphaelite Landscape Painter Christiana Payne September 21, 2010, Yale University Press 304 pages, 9.5 x 11 ISBN: 9780300165753 See the Yale University Press page.

item.title: Johns - Braginton
item.description: Family page for Edmund Allen Johns and Edmund Allen Johns married Clara Braginton in 1857. See their marriage record transcription, and the BMD record. From the page above, and the census records below, and that listed in Helena Emmeline Langford’s page, Clara Louisa and Edmund Allen had at least three children: Ellen Maccarmick Johns (1859 - 1938) Richard Braginton Johns (1862 - 1952) Edmond Allen Johns (1865 - 1929) See BMD birth records for Ellen and Edmund Allen

item.title: Langford - Braginton
item.description: Henry A Langford married Clara Louisa Johns (née Braginton) in 1866, in Plymouth (BMD record). This Burke’s peerage entry states that Helena Emmeline Langford was the daughter of Henry A. Langford. Apart from Helena Emmeline, there was only one other Langford born in Plymouth between 1864 and 1890 - Albert Leonard Langford, in 1868 (BMD record). Albert Leonard Langford died at age 11, also in Plymouth, which would explain why he is not in Clara Louisa’s Household in the 1881 census (BMD record).

item.title: Margaret Joy Whitehead
item.description: Margaret Joy went by “Joy”. Her parents were Gilbert Hinds Whitehead and Helena Emmeline Whitehead. Margaret Joy was born on 5 May 1928 (see Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage). She married John Brett in 1928. John died in 1941. Joy married Robert Clement Giles in 1965 (see Burke’s reference above). She died in 1981 (BMD record).

item.title: Marriage certificate transciption for Johns-Braginton
item.description: From this Cornwall OPC database using search “Clara Braginton”: Field Value Day Month 08-Jan Year 1857 Parish Or Reg District St. Giles in the Wood, Devon Groom Fn Edmund Allen Groom Sn JOHNS Groom Age upwards of 21 Groom Residence Gerrans Groom Condition B Groom Rank Profession Gentleman Groom Signed / Marked (S/M) S Bride Fn Clara Louisa Bride Sn BRAGINTON Bride Age 19 but under 21 Bride Residence St.

item.title: Marriage certificate transciption for Whitehead-Langford
item.description: From this Cornwall OPC database using seach “Helena Langford”. Field Value Day Month 10-Apr Year 1901 Parish Or Reg District Michael Penkevil, St. Groom Fn Gilbert Hinds Groom Sn WHITEHEAD Groom Age 34 Groom Residence Wilmington Manor, Kent Groom Condition Bachelor Groom Rank Profession Art Printer Groom Signed / Marked (S/M) S Groom Father Name James, Sir, Bart.

item.title: Michael Brett
item.description: From Christiana Payne’s biography of John brett p 109, Michael born on July 1871. See Michael’s Wikisource data. This suggests his BMD birth record. His parents were John Brett and Mary Howcroft. Michael Brett married Nellie Mary Lee. There is a page on Michael at ancestry.co.uk. He died on 9 December 1943, with probate: BRETT Michael of Hangerlea Stansted-road Bishops Stortford Hertfordshire died 9 December 1943 at Teignmouth Devonshire Probate Llandudno 17 April to Nellie Mary Brett widow.

item.title: MyHeritage entry for Mary Ann Howcroft
item.description: There is a Mary Ann Brett at this MyHeritage.com page that appears to match John Brett’s partner and Michael’s mother. Mary Ann Brett, Brett (born Howcroft) was born on month day 1843, at birth place, to William HOWCROFT and Mary Anne HOWCROFT (born HALL). William was born in 1791, in Yorkshire, England. Mary was born on April 21 1815, in Worthing, Sussex, England. Mary was baptized on month day 1844, at baptism place.

item.title: Roe - Braginton
item.description: The family of Samuel Henry Farwell Roe and Alice Jane Braginton. They married in 1890 (BMD record). It seems they had no children. Alice Jane was 44 when they married.

item.title: Samuel Henry Farwell Roe
item.description: See Farwell Roe Genenet page. Births Sep 1856 Roe Samuel Henry Farwell Camelford 5c 10 Farwell Roe married Alice Jane Braginton in 1890. Farwell was vicar at Zennor, Cornwall from 1888 to 1900. From this blog on an historical diary about Saint Senara’s church at Zennor: However, by the late 19th Century the Church had become neglected and when the Reverend Samuel Henry Farwell Roe became Vicar in 1888 he realised it was in need of restoration.

item.title: Whitehead - Langford
item.description: About the family of Gilbert Hinds Whitehead and Helena Emmeline Langford. See Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage for full summary of Whitehead family tree to 1949. From that source, the couple: Married on 10 April 1901; had one child Margaret Joy, on 5 May 1928. See transcription of full marriage record, and BMD record.

item.title: Whitehead family grave
item.description: This site about a gravesite for the Whitehead family has the following information: Gilbert Hinds Whitehead Third son of Sir James Whitehead. Bart. Born 26th May 1886, died 18th December 1908 Helena Emmeline, wife of the above Born 10 May 1872, died 18 Oct 1949

Reverend Samuel Henry Farwell Roe Births Sep 1856 (>99%) Roe Samuel Henry Farwell Camelford 5c 10 Deaths Mar 1943 (>99%) ROE Samuel H F 86 Barnstaple 5b 567 A grave from Marlborough Road Cemetery, Ilfracombe, Devon: https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124810872/farwell-roe """ Sacred to the memory of Revd Farwell Roe died 19th March 1943 Also of Jane Roe, his wife, died 23rd February 1948." """ Deaths Mar 1948 (>99%) Roe Jane 69 Barnstaple 7a 293

item.title: Talking to Marting Brett
item.description: Conversation between Matthew and Martin Brett, 10 May 2020 Helena Emmeline preferred “Emmeline”. Emmeline lived with “Aunt Alice” and an unfriendly vicar in Zennor, in Cornwall. She (Granny Whitehead) would do an impression of the thick accent of the postman. A distant relative, surname Johns, gave a significant amount of money to Emmeline in his will, enough to buy a car.
